s.text: Association between APOE gene polymorphism and diabetic nephropathy may be weak or moderate, but not strong.
Familial and epidemiological studies have indicated that there is a strong genetic component in the aetiology of diabetic nephropathy in Type I diabetes patients [ 1, 2].
The distribution of the APOE genotypes is shown in Table 2. There was no significant difference in APOE genotype and allele frequency between nephropathic and normoalbuminuric diabetic patients.
At entry the patients had HbAlc levels of 5.7 to 16.
There are three common alleles, E2, E3, and E4, which code for three major isoforms, resulting in six common genotypes [ 3, 4].
